summary: Cross Labs is a research institute, part of [Cross Compass Ltd.](https://www.cross-compass.com/en), which focuses on understanding intelligence from the point of view of Artificial Life (Alife). As a research scientist, my main projects revolved around the themes of *"Universal Communication"*: allowing any kind of agents to communicate over any kind of medium; and *"Perception Augmentation"*, which started as an exploration on how to augment human capabilities through the use of tools, then expanded into experiential transfer. As a laboratory manager, I was tasked with improving both the physical and virtual space used by other researchers. This includes building and configuring a dedicated server, designing the office's layout, and defining an inventory/storage solution.

As a member of the Research and Development department, I participated in the creation of a workshop for the Museum called [Le Vaisseau](http://www.levaisseau.com/en/). The aim of the workshop was to introduce children between the age of five and twelve to various concepts in AI. I was put in charge of developing a group activity, whose purpose was to categorize audio clips, consisting in a person mimicking the sound of an object or animal. For example, a child would imitate the sound of a car or a lion, and the system would output a corresponding image. To this end, I implemented a CNN-based classifier using Mel-frequency ceptsrum coefficients as inputs, and trained it on relevant data from [Google's Audioset](https://research.google.com/audioset/). The resulting architecture achieved an 80% accuracy when tested on recording of people mimicking sounds.
Developed material for the laboratory sessions of the 'Machines and Intelligence' (COM1005) module, whose purpose was to introduce the Nao robot and its Pyton API to students.

Part of the maintenance team for the French newspaper: [Le Monde](https://www.lemonde.fr/en/?preferred_lang=en), whose mission is to fix any problems within the publication software or the company's website.
The main mission was the development of a Web Application to manage the customers of an insurance company, along with their different contracts.

A company, created with Nicolas Ilhe, whose focus was on building website and web-designs. It also provided web hosting services. The purpose of this project was to gain experience in programming, management, and client relationship.
